Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Upload unit test results" (#2782) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
There was some unexpected and unforeseen fallout from commit 241d9416:
`make package-build-status` is only run once.

This doesn't *sound* problematic -- hence the oversight -- but the
`msbuild*.binlog` files that the `xa-build-status*.zip` file contained
prior to commit 241d9416 contained *unit test execution logs*, e.g.
`msbuild-*-Target-RunApkTests.binlog`	which contains on-device
execution of the `.apk` unit tests.

However, these files don't exist until *after* the unit tests are run.
Meanwhile, `make package-build-status` is executed *before* unit tests
are run, and thus the resulting `xa-build-status*.zip` file no longer
contains unit test information!

(This makes it rather difficult to actually review anything about unit
test execution!)

The fix?  Update the `$(MSBUILD_BINLOG)` Make `define` so that it now
takes an optional 3rd parameter: part of the directory name to place
files into, which defaults to `Build`.  (This allows overriding things
so that unit-test related `.binlog` files now go into
`bin/Test$(Configuration)`, not `bin/Build$(Configuration)`.)

Additionally, *rename* the `make package-test-errors` rule to
`make package-test-results`, have it produce an `xa-test-results*.zip`
file, and include the `bin/Test$(Configuration)/msbuild*.binlog` files
into `xa-test-results*.zip`.

`make package-test-results` is executed after unit tests are executed,
so this change allows us the uploaded `xa-test-results.zip` file to
contain unit test execution results.

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Bump to mono/mono/2018-08@56906e23" (#2778) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Context: https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/issues/2679

Bumps to mono/api-snapshot@a388436d

Crash reporting improvements.

Make `System.dll` internals visible to `Mono.Android`.

Events.RelatedBody:
There was some unexpected and unforeseen fallout from commit 241d9416:

This doesn't *sound* problematic -- hence the oversight -- but the
`msbuild*.binlog` files that the `xa-build-status*.zip` file contained
prior to commit 241d9416 contained *unit test execution logs*, e.g.
`msbuild-*-Target-RunApkTests.binlog`	which contains on-device
execution of the `.apk` unit tests.

However, these files don't exist until *after* the unit tests are run.
Meanwhile, `make package-build-status` executed *before* unit tests
are run, and thus the resulting `xa-build-status*.zip` file no longer

Additionally, *rename* the `make package-test-errors` rule to

file, and include the `bin/Test$(Configuration)/msbuild*.binlog` files
into `xa-test-results*.zip`.

`make package-test-results` is executed after unit tests are executed,
so this change allows us the uploaded `xa-test-results.zip` file to
contain unit test execution results.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] support enhanced fastdev + D8" (#2781) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
A couple problems where happening when you mix:

    <AndroidDexTool>d8</AndroidDexTool>
    <AndroidFastDeploymentType>Assemblies:Dexes</AndroidFastDeploymentType>

It seems the D8 MSBuild targets weren't doing the right thing:

* D8 targets are using `@(_JavaLibrariesToCompile)` throughout, but
  should be using `@(_JavaLibrariesToCompileForAppDx)` to be "aware"
  of enhanced fastdev.
* D8/R8 are generally more strict about missing libraries, so we need
  to make sure a `--lib` switch is added for all the Java libraries.
  Since their dex files are fast deployed, they won't be dexed by the
  calls here.

So the changes here are:

* Rename `@(_JavaLibrariesToCompileForAppDx)` to just
  `@(_JavaLibrariesToCompileForApp)` so it makes sense for DX and D8.
* Use `@(_JavaLibrariesToCompileForApp)` throughout the D8 targets.
* Add the Java libraries to `@(AndroidExternalJavaLibrary)` when
  `$(_InstantRunEnabled)` is `True`. This will add the `--lib` switch
  for each library during the `<D8/>` or `<R8/>` call.
* I switched to using `<ItemGroup/>` over `<CreateItem/>`

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[mono-2018-10] No longer able to load certain 64bit system libraries" (#2780) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
I'm encountering a new crash on startup when running certain projects on 64bit devices that appears to only occur against builds from https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-android/tree/mono-2018-10.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Download and run https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-samples/tree/master/SkiaSharpForms/MandelAnima on device a 64bit device. If deploying in Release mode, ensure `arm64-v8a` is enabled as a supported ABI.

This results in the following crash:
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-37f88bd9516342a0b03dfc95c16ddb3d.txt

#### Secondary steps to Reproduce
1. Download and run https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-samples/tree/master/FormsGallery on device a 64bit device. If deploying in Release mode, ensure `arm64-v8a` is enabled as a supported ABI.
2. Click on the "OpenGLView" page.

This results in the following crash:
http://xqa.blob.core.windows.net/gist/report-01671efd2d8044afbb975c331373b6a5.txt
<!--
If you have a repro project, you may drag & drop the .zip/etc. onto the issue editor to attach it.
-->


### Version Information
Mono version: 5.20.0.228 (5849bb2f221)  (2019-02-26 21:33:32 -05:00)
XA version: 9.2.99.36 (HEAD/82e2d017) 
<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio, select Visual Studio > About Visual Studio, then click the Show Details button, then click the Copy Information button.

2. Paste below this comment block.
-->


<!--
1. On macOS and within Visual Studio:
    a. Click **Tools** > **SDK Command Prompt**.
    b. Within the launched `Terminal.app` window, run:

            adb logcat -d | pbcopy

2. Paste below this comment block
-->

Switch to the "Preview" tab to ensure your issue renders correctly.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[Xamarin.Android.Build.Tasks] AndroidUseAapt2 defaults to False" (#2779) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
In preparation for branching for d16-1, we need `$(AndroidUseAapt2)`
to be disabled by default.

We currently have aapt2 disabled on d16-0: ac1b29e8

I am hoping a one-line change is all we need here, since master also
has: 61716bb3

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[build] Use specific ninja binary for libzip builds" (#2777) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit f44de8e987a6fc5e80c24308dd51b7a674940773 made a change to build Windows
libraries with a specific `ninja` binary. However, it seems that there are more
places where this ninja treatment is necessary.

This commit applies the treatment to both host and Windows `libzip` builds.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[build] Use specific ninja binary for libzip builds" (#2777) at xamarin/xamarin-android
Events.RelatedBody:
Commit f44de8e987a6fc5e80c24308dd51b7a674940773 made a change to build Windows
libraries with a specific `ninja` binary. However, it seems that there are more
places where this ninja treatment is necessary.

This commit applies the treatment to both host and Windows `libzip` builds.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Crash on launch after upgrading to 3.5" (#5170) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Upgrade project from 3.4.0.1029999 to 3.5.0.129452

### Expected Behavior

There are no documented API/breaking changes, so project should be compatible.

### Actual Behavior

Crash on launch, both Android and UWP, see screenshot below.

![xamforms_missingfieldexception](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22454118/52478354-0c6f6e80-2b9d-11e9-8075-eafebc1d5f76.jpg)

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.129452
- Last known good version: 3.4.0.1029999
- IDE: Visual Studio 2017 15.9.6
- Platform Target Frameworks:
  - Android: 9.0
  - UWP: 17763
- Android Support Library Version: 28.0.0.1

### Reproduction Link

Managed to reproduce a similar exception, simply by taking a new Xamarin.Forms Master-Detail project and updating all nuget packages. See below.

![xamforms_entrypointnotfoundexception](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22454118/52481019-46dd0980-2ba5-11e9-9cda-fbad3b13927e.jpg)

[App1.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2845264/App1.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[iOS] Additional parameter on ToolbarItemExtensions.ToUIBarButtonItem in XF 4 is a breaking change" (#4644) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
As part of the Shell work (according to the history) an extra optional parameter was added to a method:

https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/blob/0a67f8b0a105fbf56b6ac704cfc283840a189817/Xamarin.Forms.Platform.iOS/Extensions/ToolbarItemExtensions.cs#L12

This was an added as an optional parameter, but that doesn't prevent libraries built against older versions of Xamarin Forms from breaking.

This change means any library using the method `ToolbarItemExtensions.ToUIBarButtonItem` will have to synchronize a source change with a Forms dependency change (which will be a problem if there are any libraries using this method that are no longer maintained).

Although I suspect the number of libraries this could affect is quite low, this just came up here: https://github.com/jsmarcus/Iconize/issues/115

It should be possible to add the new behavior as an overload (without optional parameters).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "EntryCell.IsEnabled is not working on WPF" (#5360) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
I have a EntryCell, with IsEnabled set to false. The textbox shown on the WPF item is enabled.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Put a TableView on a page, containing an EntryCell. Set its IsEnabled property to false
2. You will notice that the control at runtime, in WPF is enabled. 

### Expected Behavior

The entry should be disabled.

### Actual Behavior

The entry is not disabled.

### Basic Information

- Version with issue: 
- Last known good version: None I'm aware of
- IDE: JetBrains Rider
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - WPF:  .NET 4.7.1

Fixing it is a matter of fixing the data template. PR coming.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow TintColor and UnselectedItemTintColor as platform-specifics" (#3478) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description
Now that we have...

```
On<Android>().SetBarItemColor(Color.Red);           // Unselected image+text color
On<Android>().SetBarSelectedItemColor(Color.White); // Selected image+text color
```

...we no longer need a TabbedPage renderer for Android just to set these items. However, it is still required to have an iOS TabbedPage renderer to set the equivalents on iOS side (`TintColor` and `UnselectedItemTintColor`). For feature parity between the two (and for ease of setting these very common properties), I propose the equivalents on iOS such as...

```
On<iOS>().SetTintColor(Color.Red);                 // Unselected image+text color
On<iOS>().SetUnselectedItemTintColor(Color.White); // Selected image+text color
```

### Basic Information

Xamarin.Forms 3.1.0.697729

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "fix changed apis" (#5426) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description of Change ###
- Fix API changes

### Issues Resolved ### 
- fixes #4644
- fixes #5170

### API Changes ###
- added back default handler for HandlerAttribute
- set UpdateTextColor, UpdatePlaceHolderText, UpdateFont, UpdatePlaceholderColor, UpdateColor on the EntryRenderers to protected so they are exposed to the world
- add back *public PickerEditText(Context context, IPickerRenderer pickerRenderer) : this(context)*
- add back *public static void ApplyKeyboard(this IUITextInput textInput, Keyboard keyboard)*
- add back *public static UIKit.UIBarButtonItem ToUIBarButtonItem(this Xamarin.Forms.ToolbarItem item, bool forceName)*


### Platforms Affected ### 
- Core/XAML (all platforms)
- iOS
- Android

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Grouped ListView Header is empty under RELEASE configuration" (#5377) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
### Description

when an object returned by GroupBy function provided by Linq is binded to a grouped list view, the header is invisible under release configuration, but is visible under DEBUG mode.

as for customized data structure which can be binded to a grouped view, there's no such bug. I attached a sample project to reproduce this bug, and there're two grouped list view in a page, the first demonstrates the bug.

### Steps to Reproduce
1.  add a grouped list view to a page
2.  use GroupBy function provided by LINQ to get a grouped data structure
3.  bind the data generated by step 2 to the list view
4. change the build configuration to RELEASE

### Expected Behavior
the header is empty under RELEASE configuration, BUT it works well under DEBUG configuration

### Actual Behavior
the header should be shown

### Basic Information

- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  Xamarin.iOS Version: 12.2.1.15 (Visual Studio Community)
  - Android: SDK 9.1.7.0 
- Nuget Packages: Xamarin.Forms 2.5.1.527436 and 3.4.0.1008975, these two versions have this bug. I think that versions between these two all have this bug

- Affected Devices:

AndroidÔºå iOS
There's no such bug on UWP platform

### Screenshots

**Android**
![2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6525742/53354254-5e681080-3961-11e9-97d6-dd577c29b23f.jpg)
![3](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6525742/53354264-60ca6a80-3961-11e9-8b4e-24f131422428.jpg)

**iOS**
![1](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6525742/53354267-632cc480-3961-11e9-9413-80c4590c5171.jpg)

![4](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6525742/53354430-b6067c00-3961-11e9-9b48-c463b3f40ab1.jpg)

Reproduction Link

[tempApp.zip](https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/files/2901569/tempApp.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Various errors when building for iOS device" (#5387) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->

### Description
Whenever I'm building an app for iOS and deploying, the build fails. It only fails when building for a physical device, but it runs fine when using emulator.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create Xamarin Forms project
2. Add some NuGet dependencies
3. Build

### Expected Behavior
Build completes and debugging starts on the iOS device.

### Actual Behavior
Build fails being unable to resolve reference to 'System.Object Xamarin.Forms.DataTemplateExtensions::CreateContent(BindableObject)', in some cases it fails resolving 'ResourceLoadingQuery::.ctor()'

Log from _CompileToNative
```
Target _CompileToNative:
```

- Version with issue: 3.5.0.169047 to 4.0.0.169046-pre5 tested

- Last known good version: None

- Affected Devices: iPhone 7 and various iPads

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

Do note that the reproduction case does not feature various proprietary libraries used in the actual App, but those libraries should not interfere with the build afaik.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[VS2019 Preview 3] Build errors not showing in Error list" (#5403) at xamarin/Xamarin.Forms
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- Bug report best practices: https://github.com/xamarin/Xamarin.Forms/wiki/Submitting-Issues -->
### Description
When building an iOS Xamarin Forms project and their is an error in the build process, the error list, for example, will show 0 of 1 Error.

### Steps to Reproduce
1. Create a new Xamarin Forms project
2. Build the project to make sure it works.  Add an error.
3. Compile the project again and switch to the ErrorList

### Expected Behavior
Should see the errors listed in the ErrorList

### Actual Behavior
Errors are not shown in the ErrorList and you have to dig into the Output build log to find the issue

### Basic Information
- Version with issue: VS 2019 v 16.0.0 Preview 3.0
- Last known good version: VS 2017
- IDE:
- Platform Target Frameworks: <!-- All that apply -->
  - iOS:  <!-- The version of the iOS SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 11.1 -->
  - Android: <!-- The version of the Android SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 7.1 --> 
  - UWP:  <!-- The version of the UWP SDK you are compiling against, e.g. 16299 --> 
- Android Support Library Version: <!-- if applicable -->
- Nuget Packages:
- Affected Devices:

### Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1330087/53504509-168bdb00-3a80-11e9-92b5-451b4c19a9f9.png)

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1330087/53504693-679bcf00-3a80-11e9-9564-3b4bccf26af9.png)

<!-- If the issue is a visual issue, please include screenshots showing the problem if possible -->

### Reproduction Link

<!-- Please upload or provide a link to a reproduction case -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "OIDC login flow with Xamarin.Mac" (#5704) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
<!-- üö® STOP üö® ùó¶ùóßùó¢ùó£ üö® ùë∫ùëªùë∂ùë∑ üö® -->

<!--
Please fill in the *entire* template below.
The template is designed to avoid unnecessary delays to confirm and fix reported issues. Issues with missing information generally end up with a `need-info` label and take significantly more time to fix. Please help us help you!
For more information see https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/wiki/Submitting-Bugs-&-Suggestions
For support requests use https://www.xamarin.com/support
-->
### Steps to Reproduce

1. Create a Xamarin.Forms application for MacOS
2.  Need to authenticate to IDentityServer with OIDC hybrid flow
 

There is no implementation similar to ASWebAuthenticationSession on IOS or WebAuthenticationBroker on UWP that allows authentication on Mac.  


### Expected Behavior
Be able to invoke a method to perform authentication


### Actual Behavior
There are no libraries to allow that

### Environment
Xamarin.Forms version 3.5.0.129452

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[d16-0] [xm] Support UseHardenendRuntime in code signing" (#5688) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
- https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/4288

There is some IDE work needed to full support hardened runtime, but this is enough to allow people to support it if they are willing to use a text editor on their csproj.

Backport of #5536.

/cc @chamons

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[xi interpreter] bump mono" (#5703) at xamarin/xamarin-macios
Events.RelatedBody:
Mostly FYI for @spouliot. I backported the changes to https://github.com/mono/mono/tree/spouliot-2018-08-intr

Commit list for mono/mono:

* mono/mono@940791157f4 [interp] mixed mode fixes for delegates
* mono/mono@a5838f331bd [2018-10] [aot] abort lookup early when a method isn\u0027t available in AOT image (#13179)
* mono/mono@a0908c2327b [2018-10] AOT fixes for interp mixed mode (#13172)

Diff: https://github.com/mono/mono/compare/5df8d062938ecfa377dff031e31d7e557eef141c...940791157f41a74c40f8cfa35dadef8d2c0bf82f

Fixes https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/5622 and https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-macios/issues/5618
